name: Pablo Discobar - Reykjavík's Premier Tropical Disco Destination
description: Pablo Discobar occupies third floor at Veltusund 1 in central Reykjavík, describing itself as the city's premier tropical disco destination offering cocktails, karaoke, and chaos across two floors where playful South American theme, 1970s-1980s disco soundtrack, and deliberately over-the-top aesthetic create party atmosphere that takes itself just seriously enough—the name itself represents peak pun achievement combining Colombian drug lord Pablo Escobar with disco culture in way that's simultaneously terrible and brilliant, establishing irreverent tone that defines the venue. The bold colors mix with wooden and mirrored ceilings and pelican decorations creating visual cacophony that refuses minimalist Scandinavian restraint: neon-lit pelican on one wall, beautiful Latin tiles at bar counter, large disco ball dominating ceiling, and coordinated-yet-chaotic design scheme that feels simultaneously authentic to 1970s disco excess and self-aware about its own ridiculousness. The music delivers recognizable 1970s and 1980s disco tracks that allow singing along and dancing without requiring obscure music knowledge—this accessibility distinguishes Pablo from venues playing experimental electronic music or underground house that alienates casual dancers who want fun over credibility. The two floors provide space for different moods: ground level bar for drinking and conversation before committing to full dance mode, upper level for serious disco immersion where packed dance floor and disco ball create classic nightclub experience.
